bill_title: provide for the termination of certain parental rights of persons convicted of rape or incest, to provide for restitution in lieu of child support in those cases, to restrict contact with the child, and to provide penalties for violations thereof.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the termination of certain parental rights of persons convicted of rape or incest, to provide for restitution in lieu of child support in those cases, to restrict contact with the child, and to provide penalties for violations thereof. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 22-22 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Whenever any person is convicted of rape pursuant to the provisions of this chapter, the court shall, in any case in which a child was conceived as a result of the sexual intercourse constituting the rape, terminate forthwith, at the time of sentencing, all of the parental rights of the convicted defendant, unless, for good cause shown, by clear and convincing evidence, the court, in its discretion, finds that such termination of parental rights is not in the best interests of the child. Section 2. That chapter 22-22 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Whenever the court terminates the parental rights of a convicted defendant pursuant to section 1 of this Act, the court may, as part of the sentence, order restitution to the victim, including payments in lieu of child support to the victim if the victim elects to raise the child. Section 3. That chapter 22-22 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may, because of blood kinship to a convicted rapist whose parental rights to a child conceived as a result of the sexual intercourse constituting the rape have been terminated pursuant to section 1 of this Act, petition the court for custody, visitation, or any other right in relation to the child. Section 4. That chapter 22-22 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person, whose parental rights have been terminated pursuant to section 1 of this Act, nor any person of blood kinship to the person, may intentionally contact the child, the child's other biological parent, or either of the child's adoptive parents, concerning the child. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 5. That chapter 22-22A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Whenever any person is convicted of incest pursuant to the provisions of this chapter, the court shall, in any case in which a child was conceived as a result of the sexual intercourse constituting the incest, terminate forthwith, at the time of sentencing, all of the parental rights of the convicted defendant, unless, for good cause shown, by clear and convincing evidence, the court, in its discretion, finds that such termination of parental rights is not in the best interests of the child. Section 6. That chapter 22-22A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Whenever the court terminates the parental rights of a convicted defendant pursuant to section 5 of this Act, the court may, as part of the sentence, order restitution to the victim, including payments in lieu of child support to the victim if the victim elects to raise the child.
